fields.summary: OIDC : Overall integration of external identity provider for user with console

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.description:
Handle direction to external identity provider and response. Leverage Implicit Grant API call to oauth2 provider. Fetch token that can be passed to back end AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity to get session credentials.

There is documentation here: https://docs.globus.org/api/auth/reference/
and: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity.html

working code branch: globus-login
fields.summary: Integrate OAuth2 provider as login option.

comments.body: I've completed refactoring so that site-specific and provider specific values are stored in console.ini

Though the paths are standardized, it is probably a good idea to reference the openid-configuration for authorization_endpoint and token_endpoint.
https://auth.globus.org/.well-known/openid-configuration

TODO:
 - disable "manage credentials" option when logged in via oauth (done)
 - test/set dns_enabled with oauth login (done)
 - support account setting via login link, not hard-coded

Discovered stack creation fails when using these creds. There's a problem accessing the template. Still researching.
"Template URL is an S3 URL to a non-existent or unauthorized bucket/key. (bucket=cf-template-cp-srh6fxvigvkwxpyedga-euca, key=LoadBalanced AutoScaling Web Application.json "
parameter passed was:
'TemplateURL': u'https://objectstorage.b-22.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/cf-template-cp-srh6fxvigvkwxpyedga-euca/LoadBalanced%20AutoScaling%20Web%20Application.json'

That template seems to exist when browsing the bucket indicated.


Need to test create_image as well, since it uses temporary credentials to grant access to the bucket where the image will be created.

Create Image for Image Store images cannot work for oauth login since it creates new credentials. Doing that would require another redirect to globus to acquire a token and then grant credentials. I'll try rigging this up to use existing credentials to see if there are any further gotchas. (cc: [~jloza]. [~sjones])

Also getting 500 back when attempting BundleInstance, checking requests log shows:
Tue Sep 20 13:42:58 2016 7c98da0b-1aee-47fb-a9d9-ab4d9003f572::5a3b27bb-1af0-481b-8f72-25cfb3c6c302 arn:aws:euare::000248303150:user/admin /10.111.1.22:48584 /10.111.1.127:8773 eucalyptus BundleInstanceType [POST,--REDACTED--]

not finding other helpful information yet.

[~dkavanagh], are you saying we do not want to create new credentials for create image or that creating credentials fails?
[dak]
I'm suggesting that we maintain temporary credential creation, which uses a shorter duration. In order to do that, we would need to re-authenticate since we cannot retain information used to obtain the role based credentials in the first place.
I simply bypassed credential creation to test create image with role-based credentials in the short term.

I ran some of our selenium sequences and was able to press "login with globus" at the right time to force assume role creds. The tests did not run into any other problems aside from those reported above.
[~dkavanagh], fixes are now in master for instance bundling and for stack creation using role credentials ( EUCA-12752 EUCA-12753 )

I didn't see that in the PR. Did you start, but not finish a review?
Is it about auth.py:545 ? I'm not sure what the other possible messages are, but I suspect we'd want them to come through as written if they were to occur so we could diagnose. I've only ever seen "No response from host".
If we're only observing "No response from host" there, I think the PR is good to merge.
Not verified by internal QA. No report of not working from the target audience.
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
